com.finch4alice

Class Note

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.finch4alice.Note

  • public class Note
extends Object
    Representation of a musical note.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Note(String note, int octave, int duration, boolean dotted)
      Constructs a new Note instance with the specified note, octave, duration and dotted values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Note

        public Note(String note,
            int octave,
            int duration,
            boolean dotted)
        Constructs a new Note instance with the specified note, octave, duration and dotted values.
        Parameters:
        note - The note. One of: "P" (pause), "C", "C#", "D", "D#", "E", "F", "F#", "G", "G#", "A", "A#" or "B"
        octave - The octave of the note. Valid values are 0 to 8
        duration - The duration of the note. Valid values are: 1 = whole, 2 = half, 4 = quarter, 8 = eighth, 16 = sixteenth, 32 = thirty-second
        dotted - Whether the note is "dotted" or not. If true, the duration is multiplied by 1.5.

    • Method Detail

      • getNoteIndex

        public static int getNoteIndex(String note)
        Retrieves the 0-based index of the specified note.
        Parameters:
        note - The note. One of: "P" (pause), "C", "C#", "D", "D#", "E", "F", "F#", "G", "G#", "A", "A#" or "B"
        Returns:
        The index of the specified note, in the range 0 to 12.

      • setNote

        public void setNote(String note)
        Sets the note.
        Parameters:
        note - The note. One of: "P" (pause), "C", "C#", "D", "D#", "E", "F", "F#", "G", "G#", "A", "A#" or "B"

      • getNote

        public String getNote()
        Retrieves the note value.
        Returns:
        The note. One of: "P" (pause), "C", "C#", "D", "D#", "E", "F", "F#", "G", "G#", "A", "A#" or "B"

      • setNoteIndex

        public void setNoteIndex(int index)
        Sets the note by index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the note. One of: 0 = "P" (pause), 1 = "C", 2 = "C#", 3 = "D", 4 = "D#", 5 = "E", 6 = "F", 7 = "F#", 8 = "G", 9 = "G#", 10 = "A", 11 = "A#" or 12 = "B"

      • getNoteIndex

        public int getNoteIndex()
        Retrieves the index of the note.
        Returns:
        The index of the note. One of: 0 = "P" (pause), 1 = "C", 2 = "C#", 3 = "D", 4 = "D#", 5 = "E", 6 = "F", 7 = "F#", 8 = "G", 9 = "G#", 10 = "A", 11 = "A#" or 12 = "B"

      • setOctave

        public void setOctave(int octave)
        Sets the octave of the Note.
        Parameters:
        octave - The new octave for the note. Must be between 0 and 8.

      • getOctave

        public int getOctave()
        Retrieves the octave of the Note.
        Returns:
        The octave of the Note in the range 0 to 8.

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(int duration)
        Sets the duration of the Note.
        Parameters:
        duration - The new duration for the note. Valid values are: 1 = whole, 2 = half, 4 = quarter, 8 = eighth, 16 = sixteenth, 32 = thirty-second

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration()
        Retrievs the duration of the Note.
        Returns:
        The duration for the note. Will be one of 1 = whole, 2 = half, 4 = quarter, 8 = eighth, 16 = sixteenth, or 32 = thirty-second

      • setDotted

        public void setDotted(boolean dotted)
        Sets whether the Note is "dotted" or not.
        Parameters:
        dotted - Whether the note is "dotted" or not. If true, the duration is multiplied by 1.5.

      • isDotted

        public boolean isDotted()
        Retrieves whether the Note is "dotted" or not.
        Returns:
        Whether the note is "dotted" or not. If true, the duration is multiplied by 1.5.

      • getFrequency

        public double getFrequency()
        Retrieves the frequency of the Note (in Hz).
        Returns:
        The frequency of the Note (in Hz).

      • getDurationFraction

        public double getDurationFraction()
        Retrieves the duration as a fractional value.

        For example, a quarter note has a duration value of 4, and this function will return the reciprocal of that, 1/4 or 0.25.

        Returns:
        The duration of the Note as a fractional value.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Note in RTTTL format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the Note in RTTTL format.

      • toString

        public String toString(int defaultDuration,
                       int defaultOctave)
        Returns a string representation of the Note in RTTTL format, using the specified default duration and default octave.
        Parameters:
        defaultDuration - The default duration value. If the Note's duration matches the specified default value, no duration is output in the string.
        defaultOctave - The default octave value. If the Note's octave matches the specified default value, no octave is output in the string.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the Note in RTTTL format.

      • parseRTTTL

        public static Note parseRTTTL(String rtttlNote,
                              int defaultDuration,
                              int defaultOctave)
        Instantiates a new Note by parsing an RTTTL representation.
        Parameters:
        rtttlNote - The RTTTL note to parse.
        defaultDuration - The default duration value to use. Must be one of 1 = whole, 2 = half, 4 = quarter, 8 = eighth, 16 = sixteenth, or 32 = thirty-second
        defaultOctave - The default octave value to use, in the range 0 to 8.
        Returns:
        A new Note instance initialized from the specified RTTTL note string.
